post0.title: Intro to Python Notebook
post0.content: import getpass, sys def question_with_response(prompt): print("Question: " + prompt) msg = input() return msg questions = 3 correct = 0 print('Hello, ' + getpass.getuser() + " running " + sys.executable) #This command asks for your name and also introduces you on how to input a message. print("What is your name?") msg = input("My name is: ") print("Hi " + msg) print("You will be asked " + str(questions) + " questions.") question_and_answer = ("Are you ready to take a test?") #These are the questions and depending on if you answer them correct or not, your score will differ. rsp = question_with_response("1. What command is used to output a message?") if rsp == "print": print(rsp + " is correct!") correct += 1 else: print(rsp + " is incorrect!") rsp = question_with_response("2. What is the word in Python that defines a function?") if rsp == "def": print(rsp + " is correct!") correct += 1 else: print(rsp + " is incorrect!") rsp = question_with_response("3. What is the name of a message output to the user to describe the input requested?") if rsp == "prompt": print(rsp + " is correct!") correct += 1 else: print(rsp + " is incorrect!") rsp = question_with_response("4. What is your teacher's name?") if rsp == "Mr. Yeung": print(rsp + " is correct!") correct += 1 else: print(rsp + " is incorrect!") rsp = question_with_response("5. What language are we learning?") if rsp == "python": print(rsp + " is correct!") correct += 1 else: print(rsp + " is incorrect!") rsp = question_with_response("6. What period do you have APCSP?") if rsp == "4": print(rsp + " is correct!") correct += 1 else: print(rsp + " is incorrect!") #This calculates and tells you your score. print(msg + " you scored " + str(correct) +"/" + str(questions)) .

post1.title: Bash
post1.content: echo "Using conditional statement to create a project directory and project" export project_dir=$HOME/vscode export project=$project_dir/yuyuyu export project_repo="https://github.com/haeryny/yuyuyu.git" cd ~ if [ ! -d $project_dir ] then echo "Directory $project_dir does not exists... makinng directory $project_dir" mkdir -p $project_dir fi echo "Directory $project_dir exists." if [ ! -d $project ] then echo "Directory $project does not exists... cloning $project_repo" cd $project_dir git clone $project_repo cd ~ fi echo "Directory $project exists." . echo "Navigate to project, then navigate to area wwhere files were cloned" cd $project pwd echo "" echo "list top level or root of files with project pulled from github" ls echo "" echo "list again with hidden files pulled from github" ls -a echo "" echo "list all files in long format" ls -al . echo "Look for posts" export posts=$project/_posts cd $posts pwd ls -l . echo "Look for notebooks" export notebooks=$project/_notebooks cd $notebooks pwd ls -l . echo "Look for images in notebooks, print working directory, list files" cd $notebooks/images pwd ls -l . echo "Hello" .

post2.title: My First Post
post2.content: My First Post . About Me . My name is Haeryn Yu . Hi! I am a sophmore at Del Norte High School, and I am so excited to take AP Computer Science P. .

post3.title: My First Notebook
post3.content: msg = "Hello, This is my Jupyter Notebook!" print(msg) . Hello, This is my Jupyter Notebook! .

page1.title: About Me
page1.content: My name is Haeryn Yu, and I am a sophmore at Del Norte High school. . My favorite activities are tennis, drawing, and violin. My favorite food is ramen, but I also like mangoes. .

page3.title: Notes
page3.content: These are my notes for AP Computer Science Principles. . Week 1 . <li>I learned about Python and a few of the commands that we use. They are print(), prompt, def, and how variables work.</li> .

page4.title: Vocabulary
page4.content: This is my vocabulary that I will put in while taking AP Computer Science Principles. .
